intro: Callitriche autumnalis f. spathulifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf waterstar, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Plantaginaceae family. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically rounded or spatulate in shape, giving it its specific epithet "spathulifolia." The plant produces tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. This subspecies is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
